intro: Tauschia johnstoniana, commonly known as Johnston's tauschia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its unique adaptations include a thick cuticle on the leaves to reduce water loss and the ability to store water in its tissues. Tauschia johnstoniana is often found in alpine meadows and is a subject of interest for botanists studying xerophytic adaptations.
